svcsubsecinfo.para: Trouble in the vehicle charging system will be indicated by one of the following conditions:

item.para: Short life of light bulbs or other electrical equipment caused by abnormally high system voltage.
System voltmeter readings outside normal range.

svcsubsecinfo.para: These conditions can be caused by:

item.para: Since the batteries may have an internal defect, they must be checked to determine their condition. Refer to Group 08, BATTERY section of the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for battery test procedure.

Poor circuit connections in the charging system can cause an undercharged condition only. Carefully inspect all connections including ground between the alternator and battery for cleanliness and tightness. Insure that the battery terminals are clean and tight and that the batteries are dry and clean.
If the battery and circuit connection checks are satisfactory, the alternator assembly should or may be tested on the vehicle.

svcsubsecinfo.para: With the engine turned off, connect test equipment to charging system. Refer to Figure 5 for test equipment hookups as described in the following steps.

svcproc.title: VOLTAGE TEST

step1.para: Detach wiring harness connector from alternator.
Connect negative (-) lead of a voltmeter to ground and the positive (+) lead to the "I" terminal in the harness connector.

step2.para: If the voltmeter indicates battery voltage with the key on, the harness is okay.
If the voltmeter indicates low or no voltage, locate and repair the poor connection or open circuit between the batteries and the wiring harness connector.

step1.para: Connect the battery load tester to the alternator output terminal and ground, or battery leads (alternator preferred).

caution.para: Alternator output terminal is at battery voltage.

step1.para: Record voltage reading at load tester.
With all system electrical loads off, start engine and run at moderate speed (rpm).
Recheck and record voltage reading on load tester. Voltage should be higher than reading in step 5 above, but below 15 volts. All International alternators are set at 14.2 volts.

svcproc.para: If reading (step 7) is lower than previous reading (step 5), or higher than 15 volts, replace the alternator.
